alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 10:06AM EDT until March 28 at 3:43PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Griffin affecting Spalding and Fayette Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Lovejoy, Peachtree City, Fayetteville, Americus, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senioa, Griffin, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Molena, Thomaston, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...From Monday morning to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands... fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. The backyards of homes at the end of Landing Way upstream from the bridge will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 13.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning to 11.4 feet Tuesday evening. It will rise to 11.5 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
